repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (December 2020).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

finalRubric.term: In-text chapter (katai) completion statements. See selection below.

collation.desc: the front cover. Verso marbled. Shelfmark on verso.
1 folio = front guard leaf. No foliation. Recto marbled. Blank recto verso. Element of library binding.
1 folio = front guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso. Shelfmark on recto. Element of library binding.
1 folio = front guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso. Shelfmark and title on recto. 200 x 325 mm. Element of original book.
22 folios = Cittirakkataikaḷ: Mūlam. Tamil foliation 1-22 and parallel Arabic library foliation 1-22. 200 x 325 mm. The original book.
1 folio = back guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso. Element of library binding.
1 folio = back guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso. Element of library binding.

additions.desc: Title in Roman transcription printed in golden letters on the spine: CHITTIRAKKADAI TAMOUL.
BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 430 (front cover, verso).
BnF shelfmark in black pencil: Tamoul N° 430 f[1]r).

Shelfmark and title in black pencil (f[1]r):
N. 20
Chittirey Cadey

Indication, in Roman transcription, of the title to be displayed on the spine on a bound-in small sheet of paper (inserted and bound in between u3 and U1):
Chittirakkadai
Tamoul.

binding.p: Leather (brown). Title and decoration on the spine.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1730 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1868-) and to 1730 by Cabaton (1912).

acquisition.p: It appears to be the paper Un autre [livre] appelé le Chittiracaday ou fables à l'imitation de celles d'Esope and Le Chittira cadey sent by the Jesuits of the Mission du Carnate in 1729 for the library of the king of France and mentioned in ancien lists (BnF NAF 5442, f5r and f9r).

listBibl.bibl: Cittirakkaṭaikaḷ. 2021. Cittirakkaṭaikaḷ: 1730ām āṇṭu kaiyeḻutta āvaṇattiṉ accuvaṭivam. Edited by Ka. Cupāṉiṇi & Aṉant Amalatās. Ceṉṉai: Eḻiliṉi Patippakam.
Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 59, no. 430.
S.n. 1739. Catalogus codicum manuscriptorum Bibliothecae regiae. Tomus primus. Pars prima, complectens codices manuscriptos orientales. Paris: Typographia Regia. — See p. 435, no. XX.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 98r, no. 389 430.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, May 2022.
